summary: A snub from a Hollywood executive has left Prince Harry and Meghan Markle with a "terrible" label, an expert has claimed.

paragraphs: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will struggle to recover from claims they are "whingers" following a "terrible" snub from a Hollywood executive, an expert has claimed.

Royal commentator Lee Cohen was discussing how public attitudes to Harry and Meghan have changed over the years, pointing to the time when a Spotify executive claimed the Sussexes were "f****** grifters".

Bill Simmons said the title of the series the streaming giant should have launched with the couple should have been called "The f****** grifters". The snub came after Meghan's podcast was dropped by Spotify after one series.

Mr Cohen, who was a UK policy adviser to the US Congress, told The Sun: "It all started to change through so many factors and then you have executives in Hollywood calling them... 'expletive' grifters. Now that [was] just broadcast everywhere and social media created hashtags calling them 'Harry and Meghan are grifters' - what a terrible label to have.

"Grifters is so at the other end of the spectrum from, you know, the Royal Family. It's unbelievable. But that 'grifters' comment will stay with them forever and they're now the butt of Hollywood jokes by comedians and [in] cartoons... Everyone has their number, which is that they're whingers, complainers, hypocrites, all of this.
"Quite frankly I don't know how they can recover from it."
THIS IS A LIVE BLOG. SCROLL DOWN FOR THE LATEST UPDATES.

headline: The only person Prince Harry and Meghan Markle trust to look after Archie and Lilibet
paragraphs: Meghan Markle's mum, Doria Ragland is said to be the only person that Prince Harry and Meghan trust to care for their two children when they are not around.
Doria, 67, is said to have taken on the role as Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet's nanny, with the pair preferring to take on a "more traditional" approach when it comes to childcare.

headline: Meghan Markle 'turned and hissed' at a staffer leaving her in 'tears'
paragraphs: A pregnant Meghan Markle reportedly "turned and hissed" at one of her members of staff, leaving them in "tears" according to a royal correspondent who joined Meghan and Prince Harry on their royal tour.

Rebecca English of the Daily Mail recalled: "I was there at the time and witnessed Meghan turn and 'hiss' at a member of her entourage, clearly incandescent with rage about something, and demand to leave."

headline: Meghan Markle fails to compete with Princess Kate as survey reveals very telling results
paragraphs: Meghan Markle is "still less popular" than the Princess of Wales in her own country as the Sussex brand receives yet another blow following Prince Harry's acceptance of the Pat Tillman Award for Service, a recent poll has shown.
A poll of 1,500 US eligible voters conducted by Redfield and Wilton for Newsweek back in May found that Meghan was liked by just 36 percent of adults and disliked by 24 percent.

headline: Meghan Markle pal says Prince Harry 'fit plans for UK fame' after Suits
paragraphs: Meghan Markle's whirlwind romance with Prince Harry may have appeared like every girl's dream, but friends close to the Duchess said she set her sites on him for UK fame.
Ex-friends told the Daily Mail that the Suits star was growing frustrated with how her career was going in Hollywood- in 2013 she thought that the UK might be the place for her to be.

headline: Royal expert tears into Meghan Markle after she said 'she had rotten time in UK'
paragraphs: Meghan Markle has been torn apart by a royal expert who countered her claims that she had a "rotten time" when she moved to the UK due to her relationship with Prince Harry.
Michael Cole told GB News that contrary to what she believes, Meghan was welcomed to the Royal Family as a "breath of fresh air", despite the couple stepping down as working royals in 2020.

headline: Unusual way Donald Trump 'saved' Prince Harry from huge 'kick in the teeth'
paragraphs: Prince Harry's backlash for the ESPY Award acceptance was a "kick in the teeth" according to critics, but the Duke was saved from a huge amount of criticism after the attempted assassination of Donald Trump became the most important story in the news cycle.

headline: Prince Harry's heartbreaking 8-word response after King Charles evicted him from Frogmore
paragraphs: Prince Harry made a heartbreaking response to King Charles after his eviction from Frogmore Cottage last year.

At the end of June last year, a statement by a Sussex spokesperson confirming the eviction read: "We can confirm the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have been requested to vacate their residence at Frogmore Cottage."
In response to being kicked out of the property, Harry is said to have responded to his father with eight words: "Don't you want to see your grandkids anymore?"

headline: Prince Harry and Meghan celebrate as Lilibet's godfather receives prestigious award
paragraphs: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are poised to join in the celebrations as their close friend and Princess Lilibet's godfather, Tyler Perry, is set to receive a prestigious accolade this December.

The Hollywood mogul will be honoured at the star-studded Paley Honors gala in Beverly Hills on December 4, where he'll be presented with the organisation's most esteemed award for his contributions to the media industry.

headline: Meghan Markle shows true colours with tragic blog post about dad Thomas Markle
paragraphs: Meghan Markle's now-defunct blog The Tig gave a touching insight into her complicated relationship with her father, Thomas Markle Senior, whom she has now been estranged from for six years.
One post from her blog, which was published for Father's Day, heartbreakingly shows how close they once were as she detailed special memories from her childhood with him.

V1.title: 'Whingers' Harry and Meghan 'won't recover' from 'terrible' snub
